intro: Ditassa edmundoi, commonly known as the Edmond's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its small yellow flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
